results.title: Simvastatin added to ursodeoxycholic acid does not enhance disappearance of gallstone fragments after shock wave therapy.
results.text_hl: Eighteen @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with a single radiolucent @<m>DISEASE_Gallbladder_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005705 @@@gallbladder stone@@@ and a serum @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ of more than 250 mg/dl were randomly assigned to receive either @CHEMICAL_Ursodeoxycholic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014580 @@@ursodeoxycholic acid@@@ alone (750 mg per day, group A, n = 9) or in combination with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (20 mg per day, group B, n = 9) for the dissolution of the @DISEASE_Gallstones @DISEASE_MESH:D042882 @@@gallstone@@@ fragments generated by extracorporeal shock wave lithotripsy.

citations.NLM: Sackmann M, Koelbl R, Pauletzki J, Cremer P, Klueppelberg UG, von Ritter C, Sauter G, Holl J, Seidel D, Paumgartner G. Simvastatin added to ursodeoxycholic acid does not enhance disappearance of gallstone fragments after shock wave therapy. Z Gastroenterol. 1995 Oct;33(10):585-9. PMID: 7502550
citations.BibTeX: @article{7502550, title={Simvastatin added to ursodeoxycholic acid does not enhance disappearance of gallstone fragments after shock wave therapy.}, author={Sackmann M and Koelbl R and Pauletzki J and Cremer P and Klueppelberg UG and von Ritter C and Sauter G and Holl J and Seidel D and Paumgartner G}, journal={Z Gastroenterol}, volume={33}, number={10}, pages={585-9}}
